
```{r ShapeDescriptionExamples, echo=FALSE, fig.height=7, fig.width=6, fig.cap="Some common shapes of the distribution of qualitative data"}
par(mfrow=c(2,2))

blueTransparent <- rgb(0, 0, 1, alpha=0.2, maxColorValue = 1)

set.seed(110110)

xx <- c( rchisq(300, df=2), 7,7,8,7,7,7,8,7,7,6)

hist( scales::rescale(xx, to=c(0, 5)), 
      xlab="Values", ylab="Number of obs.",
      main="A: Skewed right",
      axes=FALSE,
      col=blueTransparent, 
      las=1)
axis(side=2, las=1)
box()
#dev.print(png, filename="ShapeExampleA.png", width=5, height=6,  units="in", res=100)




xx <- c( rchisq(300, df=1), 2, 2, 1, 1, 2, 0, 0)

xx <- max(xx) - xx
hist( scales::rescale(xx, to=c(0, 5)), 
      xlab="Values", ylab="Number of obs.",
      main="B: Skewed left",
      axes=FALSE,
      col=blueTransparent, 
      las=1)
axis(side=2, las=1)
box()
#dev.print(png, filename="ShapeExampleB.png", width=5, height=6,  units="in", res=100)




xx <- rnorm(500, mean=10)
hist( scales::rescale(xx, to=c(0, 10)), 
      xlab="Values", ylab="Number of obs.",
      main="C: Approx. symmetric",
      axes=FALSE,
      col=blueTransparent, 
      las=1)
axis(side=2, las=1)
box()
#dev.print(png, filename="ShapeExampleC.png", width=5, height=6,  units="in", res=100)





xx1 <- rnorm(500,mean=0, sd=1)
xx2 <- rnorm(250,mean=4, sd=1)
xx <- c( xx1[xx1>0], xx2)


hist( scales::rescale(xx, to=c(0, 10)),  
      right=TRUE,
      axes=FALSE,
      col=blueTransparent, 
      las=1,
      xlab="Values",
      ylab="Number of obs.", 
      main="D: Bimodal distribution")
axis(side=2, las=1)
box()
#dev.print(png, filename="ShapeExampleD.png", width=5, height=6,  units="in", res=100)
```
